meanings.definition: The state of lacking a sense of belonging or connection.
meanings.sent1: Her rootlessness made it hard for her to feel at home anywhere.
meanings.sent2: The rootlessness of the young orphan touched the hearts of the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The rootlessness of the lost puppy led to a comical chase around the park.
meanings.sent4: The rootlessness of the nomadic tribe was like a ship without an anchor.
meanings.sent5: The rootlessness of the ghostly figure wandering the halls was hauntingly sad.

meanings.definition: The condition of being adrift or without a stable foundation.
meanings.sent1: The rootlessness of the boat in the stormy sea was frightening.
meanings.sent2: After losing his job, he felt a deep sense of rootlessness.
meanings.sent3: The rootlessness of the balloon without a string was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The rootlessness of the sandcastle on the beach symbolized impermanence.
meanings.sent5: The rootlessness of the fallen leaf in the wind was a beautiful dance.
